I'm bummed to hear this, but I'm not letting it stop me.  I started circumnavigating the Mun before 1.0.5 came out and made it about a quarter way around.  But I restarted my career with 1.0.5, and even though I'm not quite there yet, when I'm ready, I absolutely plan on finishing what I started.

I was going to circumnavigate Kerbin, but you reminded me of my deep hatred and contradictory love of Munar missions. Mun Buggy, here we come!

Back on topic then, I have just completed the Elcano Challenge for Ike [here](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/127073-the-elcano-chronicles/).

Any feedback or comments would be appreciated.

Details: Stock, 1.0.5, wheel-driven RTG powered rover using a skycrane to drop from orbit.

Mods: Engineer ('cause who doesn't), Mechjeb, Hyperedit (for testing, since I build my missions backwards).

Update for my JoolCano-5 mission. The [mission start post](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/114732-reopened-elcano-challenge-jool-5-edition/&do=findComment&comment=2319278) is finally up, and the crew has arrived safely in Laythe orbit. This particular post is mostly for the Jool-5 proof.

I've thrown my hat into the ring and have begun a circumnavigation of the Mun.   Started a thread over in the mission reports [here](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/127768-the-great-mun-circumnavigation/) .  Feedback, comments, and general mockery at my attempt are welcome!  Back to driving...

Just update my thread back at mission reports, linked the imgur album.

I didn't know that in the last update brakes got buffed, a really welcome change! Slowing down on Minmus was a real pain before, but now it's so much easier ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif ":cool:")

Hey, guys, I've circumnavigated Minmus!

It was pretty boring, and in reality, not as difficult as I suspected. I did use MechJeb's rover autopilot. Most of the stuff I didn't need, but **stability control** was a godsend. It automatically synchronised the rover's orientation with the surface of Minmus, which, when combined with the huge amount of reaction torque I had, led to a much more stable driving experience. I recorded the entire thing with PersistentTrails, but there are a couple of spots where it glitched and stopped recording. The biggest one is across a small valley and is about 5 km, sorry about that. [Here's the link for the .trk file.](https://mega.nz/#!WcZTmaJR!WQWgmKWqLC9R7AMUMPOTL7i5r652ga_PLPeCrPq-_o0)

My main forum thread is here: [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/127794-elcano-challenge-a-waterlubber-circumnavigates-minimus/](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/127794-elcano-challenge-a-waterlubber-circumnavigates-minimus/)  

Cheers! Do note that the entire progress won't be there until a few days when I  have time to aggregate, commentate and post screenshots

Pol is up! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D") [The mission post](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/114732-reopened-elcano-challenge-jool-5-edition/&do=findComment&comment=2321900) also includes the Jool-5 pictures, but here's the Pol Elcano album.
